meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Alright, let's dive into the review! As you can tell from my introduction, I'm not exactly the next big thing in gaming journalism. But hey, someone has to do it, right? So grab a bag of popcorn (or your preferred snacking fuel) and get ready for some fun!

Octopath Traveler II - what's the tea on this sequel? Well, let me tell you that it's no surprise that the critics have been raving about it! LEVEL gave it a perfect score (100), praising its combat system, characters, and minimal bugs. Softpedia went as far as calling it one of the best JRPGs of the year, while Nintendo Life hailed it as "triumphant" and a "masterpiece." The praise goes on!

Now, I know what you're thinking - what's the catch? Is there something I should be worried about? Well, let me tell you that while some critics did mention some drawbacks. PlaySense pointed out that the game plays it safe, sticking to familiar formulas instead of taking risks. GamesBeat noted that OT2 doesn't really do anything new or different from its predecessor (OT1). Digital Trends and Inverse did give praise, though - they loved how charming and immersive the game is!

So what's my take on Octopath Traveler II? Well, let me tell you that I agree with some of the criticisms. While the game does have some great moments, it can feel a bit too similar to OT1 at times. And don't even get me started on those pesky bugs - we all know how frustrating that can be!

But hey, is this really an issue? Not according to many of these critics! They seem to agree that the game's charm, story, and visuals more than make up for any minor shortcomings. So what do I think you should do? Go ahead and give it a try! It's still a fantastic RPG with lots to offer.
